TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SByteConverter extends System.ComponentModel.BaseNumberConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert 8-bit unsigned integer objects to and from a string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can convert only an 8-bit unsigned integer object to and from a string.
The <xref:System.SByte> value type represents integers with values ranging from negative 128 to positive 127. This data type is not supported in Visual Basic.
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of SByteConverter. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](../Topic/How%20to:%20Implement%20a%20Type%20Converter.md).
## Examples The following sample converts a variable of type <xref:System.SByte> to a string, and vice versa.
[!code-cs[Converters#18](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.componentmodel._133_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Converters#18](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.componentmodel._133_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Converters#18](~/add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.componentmodel._133_1.cpp)]
